subject: Re: My mistruths...
author: babiarz3
full_text:
Mike,
I don't know if he tried to hide the article or not. It may have been
a coincidence that it disappeared within hours of me posting what had
been said. It took me awhile but, I re-found it. I'm going to assume
that if he really wanted it to completely disappear it would have.
Although, writers are funny about their works. 
His stating openly that he'd like to bring it into schools... that's
plain crazy. All my thoughts on negativity aside, do you really think
schools and parents will allow someone to bring a spirit communication
device into the class? "Alright kiddos, this morning I'm going to let
you listen to the voice of your dead relatives and who ever else might
decide to speak. Oh, and by the way, sometimes they use profanity. But
don't be scared."
However, my point of contention remains the same. Children and high
school students should not be used as testing subjects. The attitude
of we'll "see what happens" is irresponsible at best.  
I do not know if Chris has tried the radio shack hack or not. I do
know that messages and emails are coming in stating no success. I do
not know the reasons for the lack of success. It could be as simple as
not hacking it correctly, lack of ability to hear the voices... It
could also just not work for everyone. I know that even REG has stated
here that she couldn't get reception on the Queen Mary in Long Beach
California nor in a radio station for C2C, for the mini-box and other
devices she has. That confuses me some but... Also, another researcher
claimed to be unable to use his device due to fluorescent lighting. 
It seems that the jury is still out. I'm watching closely. I just hope
that the whole children and high school student thing is reconsidered.
They need to be old enough to make an informed educated decision on
whether or not they wish to be part of the testing group.

<michaelcoletta@...> wrote:
